1.text: In our societies we use the word "success" a lot

8.text: and we think we know just what it means: money, status, fame, and power.

13.text: But take a look in the dictionary and things start to look, thankfully, a lot more complicated.

18.text: Because success is, in truth, rather more neutral and less value-laden then we tend to assume.

26.text: It just means doing anything well,  excelling at something

31.text: and that might encompass a lot of different activity:

35.text: running 100 meters, for sure, selling your app for a lot of money, okay,

40.text: but also stranger, less heralded things like: listening a lot, very attentively, to a child,

48.text: or being extremely kind to strangers, or filling your mind with interesting ideas and associations,

55.text: or knowing just when to put  an arm around someone when it's too much for them.

60.text: People who triumph here are also big success stories.

65.text: No one can be successful at everything, whatever they tell us,

69.text: it's almost impossible to succeed with a career and a family,

86.text: It's even better to make sure you followed your own distinctive and, not necessarily, always obvious path

93.text: to the success that can truly fulfill you.
